summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 regarding the status of financial records subpoenaed from USAA bank for Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal case. It shows coordination between legal staff and an Assistant U.S. Attorney about receiving and distributing the records, indicating ongoing evidence gathering for the prosecution.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of a subpoena for banking records from USAA as part of a criminal investigation. Her name is on the invoice and claim for the requested records.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (BYRNE, PAUL) on the email chain, indicating FBI involvement in the process of obtaining Maxwell's financial records.

connections.description: Byrne, as an FBI agent, is involved in the investigative process to obtain Maxwell's financial records via subpoena.

events.title: USAA Records Request Initiated
events.description: A request for banking records from USAA for Ghislaine Maxwell is logged in the ClaimFox system, with an invoice generated.

events.title: Coordination on Received Records
events.description: Email correspondence confirms receipt of the USAA records for Maxwell and notes a copy was delivered to SDNY (Southern District of New York) the prior week.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A subpoena for Ghislaine Maxwell's banking records from USAA was processed in late December 2019, as part of the criminal investigation against her.
The records were received by the prosecution team in early January 2020, and a copy was delivered to the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
FBI Agent Paul Byrne was copied on the email chain, confirming law enforcement's role in the financial evidence gathering.
The email chain highlights the use of a third-party service, ClaimFox, to manage and track record requests for the investigation.
